ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] getting ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException after using Http Client in decide rule.

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] getting ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException after
 using Http Client in decide rule.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=DYzbDDVmi_GAXl2nIFBJqNSV3NPXgx_NCiN9MqmUGWM0
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Because the exception is triggered in toString() code called from...

 >org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MyDecideRule.evaluate(MyDecideRule.java:78)

...that code, rather than your checkOptionsMethod() code, would offer 
the best hints for what's going wrong.

I don't know how widely servers support the OPTIONS method; in any event 
it isn't often issued against URIs. So running a crawl where you run 
OPTIONS against every URI might be resented webmasters. Just FYI.

- Gordon @ IA

peter.goras wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I created a DecideRule that checks for every CrawlURI what methods 
> (POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.) are allowed. Therefore, I am using the HTTP 
> OPTIONS method that is provided by the
> "org.apache.commons.httpclient.methods.OptionsMethod" package.
> 
> //#######################################
> My code snippet looks like this:
> 
> private void checkOptionsMethod(String uri) {
>     HttpClient client = new HttpClient();
>     OptionsMethod options = new OptionsMethod(uri);
> 
>     try {
>         client.executeMethod(options);
>         
>         if (options.isAllowed("POST")){
>             System.out.println("POST is allowed...");
>         }
> 
>     } catch (Exception e) {
>         e.printStackTrace();
>     } finally {
>         options.releaseConnection();            
>     }
> }
> //#######################################
> 
> Unfortunately, I am getting the following exception:
> 
> java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1
>     at 
> org.archive.io.Latin1ByteReplayCharSequence.charAt(Latin1ByteReplayCharSequence.java:201)
>     at 
> java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append(AbstractStringBuilder.java:463)
>     at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:179)
>     at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:172)
>     at 
> org.archive.io.Latin1ByteReplayCharSequence.toString(Latin1ByteReplayCharSequence.java:362)
>     at org.archive.crawler.decider 
> ules.MyDecideRule.evaluate(MyDecideRule.java:78)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MyDecideRule.decisionFor(MyDecideRule.java:34)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecideRuleSequence.decisionFor(DecideRuleSequence.java:76)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecidingFilter.innerAccepts(DecidingFilter.java:71)
>     at org.archive.crawler.framework.Filter.accepts(Filter.java:93)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.deciderules.FilterDecideRule.filtersAccept(FilterDecideRule.java:124)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.deciderules.FilterDecideRule.filtersAccept(FilterDecideRule.java:108)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.deciderules.FilterDecideRule.decisionFor(FilterDecideRule.java:92)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecideRuleSequence.decisionFor(DecideRuleSequence.java:76)
>     at org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.ru 
> lesAccept(Processor.java:179)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.rulesAccept(Processor.java:175)
>     at org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process(Processor.java:111)
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:302)
>     at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:151)
> 
> FATAL org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread recoverableProblem Problem 
> java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1 occured when trying to 
> process 'http://www.abbreviations.com/robots.txt' at step 
> ABOUT_TO_BEGIN_PROCESSOR in Archiver
> 
> //#######################################
> 
> Do you think I should use the methods of the  "org.archive.httpclient" 
> package instead?
> 
> I would appreacheate any hint. Please help me!
> 
> Best Regards,
> Peter
> 
>
